name: Somewhat odd combo, but... Paladin/Druid anyone?
author: Cornflower

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
This weird question has its root in the Jormungandr Druid/Cleric/Monk combo. I was playing this on Blackstone Keep, a very high-magic PW, and after a while I realized that the druid spells work very well on that PW, the combat better than expected, but the Dragon Shape not so much (even though it's awesome and fun). I also realized that what was missing was mostly AB and fighter feats. Another thing that I was missing was divine damage that will cut through boss resistance/immunities, so that got me thinking about this combination. Druid for spells and other coolness, Paladin (as opposed to cleric) for number of attacks, great AB and nice divine damage.

The way it might work would be to start out as paladin in order to get the hack-n-slash going, then add up more druid levels to be able to kill high-level critters and bosses later on. Maybe even a dex-based paladin, in order to increase survivability (with the BSK socket gem systems, I don't need STR for damage, you can create extreme high-damage weaponry), which led me to think Elf or halfling. Also, dagger/sickle seems to be the only weaponry that would work both with a dex-based Paladin and Druid (rapier if elven). Maybe add some Rogue skill dumps to get UMD and Tumble so I could use all the high-level magic items that's laying around. Also, wands.

So, I need at least Druid 17 (all spells), Rogue 2 and Paladin 15 (all spells). Now, I started building this in the excel thingy, but then I realized I should instead ask the professionals.

I would wish to get Druid 11 fairly early, since it gives Stonehold, which reduces stress a lot.

So, here's my questions: Is this viable, or just plain stupid?
Also, should I go Pal21/Druid17/Rogue2 or Druid21/Pal17/Rogue2? Or maybe something else entirely?
Dex-based or not?  (Note that on BSK, the difference is not that big between a d4 dagger and a d12 Greataxe when you can add +2d12 acid, +2d12 sonic, +2d12 fire, keen, +2d12 mass crit to any weapon. Theoretically, but maybe +2d10/+2d8/+d10/keen/+2d12 which I actually have on a scimitar.)

And, yes, I'm aware of the need for alignment change, which is easy to do on Blackstone from Lawful Good to Lawful Neutral or Lawful Neutral to Lawful Good. You can do it several times. (You just give the beggar some gold or push him away, simple.)

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
After a while, I stumled over this, which tells me I'm not that far out of my mind.... :-)

green-knight-of-ehlonna-druid-28-ftr-4- ... 53943.html

Still, I would like to see if dropping some druid levels and use Rogue/Paladin would be interesting.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Mmmm not sure I can help a huge amount as I dont know the server that well or the class combos, but if you multi class with rogue with a dex focus, you will possibly want to get uncanny dodge to protect your dex AC? So Rogue 3? 

Rogue 3 is my favourite number of levels in rogue by the way

I guess what paladin spells are you keen on, and what feats are you interested in?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Paladin is a M.A.D class by the way - Multiple Attribute Dependent. Pretty much every stat except intelligence and dexterity (to an extent obviously) is important to a Paladin. 

I think MAD builds would be strong in a high magic environment because all these stats can be boosted by 12 but I haven't played heaps in these types of environments (well unless one considers HoTU somewhat of a high-ish environment with the ability to get +10 weapons at lvl 28 with 1d6 or 1d8 elemental damage and DC 20 odd 1d2 strength damage - sort of true I guess)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: There is an alignment conflict with this build idea.  A Paladin must remain Lawful Good, or he will become a fallen Paladin.  In order to take levels as a Druid, you must have the word Neutral in your alignment, so Lawful Neutral or Neutral Good would be fine, but not Lawful Good.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
There was a dragon build with paladin, hmm, sir smokesalot?  wait...
Yeah, here it is & it is almost 1.69 compatible as well.
http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 17475.html
Now, this will need a big update with things they did not know back in 2004, no divine shield for example, already at 20 dodge cap with dragon shape alone, etc.

But it won't be better than OoJ anyway, so just get an idea on how it might work with the divine dmg from there.
Now, there is also the possibility of Druid 28/ Monk 2/ Shifter 10 that might interest you.
Why? Because this dragon can breathe really well, I think 20d10 every round or so. You know, high AC/resistances & infinite breath, etc. You get the idea
Plus, that one will also get far better caster levels & a better DC for his spells as well, so for BSK, this might actually be a stronger (blasphemy!) dragon than OoJ.

And then, there is also the Druid champion (no dragon in this one) build, with Druid 24/ Pally 15/ Cheese Monk 1, or if you want this more playable, just lower the druid a bit & add more Bruce Lee Monk.
You won't need dexterity at all, since Zen Archery will cover you for ranged attacks if you want this, but will still suffer from MAD.
You will want to have high charisma of course, and it suits us just fine that you do not particularly care about strength, since we can add more charisma that way, which in turn will net stronger divine might/shield.
Perhaps Druid 20/ Pally 18/ Chuck Norris Monk 2, for playability, with starting stats: (Str 16, Dex 08, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 16) ending in (Str 24, Dex 08, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 20, Cha 18) or something similar.
One problem that I see here is that you won't have a stellar AB this way. I calculate something like 37 +6 +20= 63AB top (without smite), which is at the low-end for your server, but you will still have your spells, with a decent DC/Penetration.

A world of choices, oh, I love this game!
